title: How to Make a Chest in Minecraft: A Simple Tutorial

steps.title: Place the planks in the crafting table.
steps.content: Place the planks in the crafting table. Use the chest recipe to craft the chest: Arrange the planks in every slot, apart from the middle one.

steps.title: Place the chest.
steps.content: Place the chest. Always place a chest with free space above it. Otherwise, you won't be able to open it! Note that there are a few blocks that won't stop the chest from being opened if they're placed on top of it. These include: water, lava, leaves, cactus, glass, snow, stairs, farmland, cake, beds, fence, another chest, a torch, rails, signs, and a few more (translucent blocks). As of Minecraft 1.13, you can place more than two chests next to each other.

steps.title: Make the chest as for the single chest above.
steps.content: Make the chest as for the single chest above. You can't craft a large chest.

steps.title: Place two chest blocks adjacent to each other.
steps.content: Place two chest blocks adjacent to each other. You now have a large chest. You must place both chests from the same direction for them to connect into a large chest. If you hold shift while placing the chest, it won't connect and make a large chest.

steps.title: Make a tripwire hook.
steps.content: Make a tripwire hook. These are made by, in a crafting table, putting 1 plank on top of a stick, on top of an iron ingot.

steps.title: Combine the hook and the chest in the crafting table.
steps.content: Combine the hook and the chest in the crafting table. This is a shapeless recipe. Note that you can put two trapped chests next to each other, to make a large chest.

steps.title: Note that chests are designed with compass orientation that affects placement of items.
steps.content: Note that chests are designed with compass orientation that affects placement of items. The top three rows in the chest correspond to the western or northern chest block. The bottom three rows correspond to the southern or eastern chest block. In the large chest, you'll find the items organized into the southern or eastern side, which will depend on the orientation of the chest.

steps.title: Right click on the chest.
steps.content: Right click on the chest. It will open.

steps.title: Transfer items into the chest.
steps.content: Transfer items into the chest. Shift click on the item. The item will go into a slot that's available for it.

steps.title: Transfer items out of the chest.
steps.content: Transfer items out of the chest. As with the previous step, shift click on the item in the chest and it will come out of the chest. Left clicking will help you to collect all of the items in the slot. Left click again to place items. Right clicking will let you take just half of the items in a slot. Right click to place a single item.

steps.title: Close the chest.
steps.content: Close the chest. This can be done by simply pressing the inventory button or the ESC button.

steps.title: Look for goodies to grab from naturally occurring chests.
steps.content: Look for goodies to grab from naturally occurring chests. NPC villages are a great place to look. You can also check in abandoned mineshafts, jungle and desert temples and strongholds.
